plunder.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere, especially while fighting in a war
plunder.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The rich provinces of Asia Minor were plundered by the invaders.
plunder.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to use up all or most of the supplies of something in a careless way
plunder.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Unlicensed fishermen have plundered tuna stocks.
the egotism of man as he plunders our planet
plunder.translation[1].definitions[0].de: things that have been stolen during a violent attack, especially during a war
plunder.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Henry’s army returned loaded down with plunder.
plunder.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere
plunder.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: When President, he plundered much of his country’s wealth.
plunder.translation[3].definitions[0].de: large amounts of money or property that have been stolen
plunder.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: The army returned loaded down with plunder.
plunder.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: The dictator’s fortune was amassed during three decades of plunder of his own country.
